title: Investments in startups grew by more than 45% per annum in 2021

category: Singapore Week of Innovation and TeCHnology

The post Investments in startups grew by more than 45% per annum in 2021 appeared first on e27.
content:encoded:
Singapore’s innovation and startup ecosystem has continued to experience strong growth over the past five years, remaining vibrant and resilient amid the pandemic. As a signal of confidence in the startup investment scene, funding activities have increased exponentially to reach S$14.7 billion in 2021, growing by more than 45% per annum between 2017 and 2021. Venture funding within the nine months of 2022 alone has reached S$11.4 billion.

To ensure that Singapore remains a vibrant and attractive startup and innovation hub, Enterprise Singapore (EnterpriseSG) will continue to deepen their support for innovative startups and SMEs. This includes catalysing more financing opportunities, providing the right platforms and infrastructure to drive the development of innovative solutions, building their pipeline of local and global talent, and deepening global connections.

Also read: Journey to the top: From developer to CEO

Tapping new opportunities through innovation platforms and networks

Recognising the need to scale overseas, EnterpriseSG has supported over 780 companies through their Global Innovation Alliance (GIA) programmes, which connects them to international business and tech communities and drive two-way collaboration. This includes their Co-Innovation Programmes (CIPs), where companies jointly develop and test-bed new solutions with trusted in-market partners before scaling into the market or region. On top of three pilot GIA acceleration programmes in Sydney, Stockholm and Cape Town introduced earlier this year, EnterpriseSG also announced two new GIA nodes in Abu Dhabi and Seoul at the Singapore Week of Innovation and Technology (SWITCH) 2022. These GIA acceleration programmes will help more Singapore-based startups and tech small and medium enterprises (SMEs) link up with global partners and access market opportunities.

EnterpriseSG and its partners have continued to encourage enterprises to press on with innovation efforts even during the pandemic, with 600 enterprises undertaking innovation projects to develop new products and solutions in 2021. Partners like IPI Singapore and the Centres of Innovation (COI) have played an instrumental role in helping companies deepen business innovation and tech capabilities. EnterpriseSG is looking to increase the capacity of its centres to accelerate SMEs’ and startups’ innovation journeys further, and recently launched three new COIs for Advanced Materials, Beauty and Personal Care, and Urban Agriculture.

To nurture a more vibrant startup ecosystem and catalyse growth through market-led innovation, EnterpriseSG launched the Open Innovation Network in 2019 to encourage co-innovation by both private and public stakeholders.

Also read: How can we create new urgency for a green recovery?

At SWITCH, EnterpriseSG launched new open innovation challenges, including the fourth edition of the Sustainability Open Innovation Challenge, fourth Trade and Connectivity Challenge, and the first India Open Innovation Challenge. Building on past open innovation challenges, the agency will work with new partners to facilitate demand-led innovation and test-bedding opportunities to address challenges in sectors like Energy, Healthcare, Agritech and more.

Supporting startup efforts in Singapore

Since its launch in 2017, the Startup SG4 initiative has played a pivotal role in supporting startups by helping to galvanise funding, increase access to mentor and partnership networks, and connect startups with overseas markets to scale abroad.

  • The access to financing has made Singapore an ideal location in Southeast Asia to raise funds. As part of Startup SG Equity, more than S$51 million was co-invested across 58 startups through SEEDS Capital and SGInnovate, catalysing over S$400 million in private investments in 2021.
  • Entrepreneurship has seen a boost. The number of innovative startups supported through the Startup SG Founder (SSGF) reached close to 480 as of June 2022, growing by 47% per annum since the initiative started in 2017. Of these, 104 startups have raised publicly disclosed rounds amounting to over S$350 million. On average, they secured pre-seed funding more than 1.5x faster than their Southeast Asian counterparts between 2017 and 2022.

Year-long innovation efforts culminate at SWITCH 2022 Flagship Event

The year-long innovation movement, the Singapore Week of Innovation and TeCHnology (SWITCH), culminated in the SWITCH Flagship Event, which was held in person at the Resorts World Convention Centre from 25 to 28 October 2022. at the Resorts World Convention Centre from 25 to 28 October 2022. More than 9,000 participants – startups, entrepreneurs, investors, MNCs and public sector leaders – convened to discuss emerging trends and opportunities in Health and Biomedical Sciences, Trade & Connectivity, Frontier Technologies and many other areas, as well as ways in which the community can innovate and collaborate to generate positive global impact. The event also featured more than 350 speakers and over 300 exhibitors from the global research, investor and startup communities.

Also read: How startups should approach ESG opportunities

This year’s SWITCH Flagship Event comprised three main stages: SWITCH Beyond, focused on exploring the latest sector trends and innovation opportunities in Asia; SWITCH Global, to spotlight emerging market access opportunities and catalyse cross-border collaboration; SLINGSHOT at the SWITCH Grand Stage, where the top 50 global startups from Asia’s leading deep tech startup competition pitched to a live audience of investors and corporate judges. The top 50 finalists also participated in an inaugural immersion programme in Singapore and connected with the local innovation and startup ecosystem.

Peptobiotics, a Singapore-based startup that leverage advances in both human medicine and synthetic biology to create an antibiotic-free agricultural system, emerged the winner of the grand prize at the finals of SLINGSHOT 2022. The first runner-up was E3A Healthcare and second runner-up was Wasna, which both competed in the Healthcare and Biomedical challenge domain.

About Enterprise Singapore

Enterprise Singapore (EnterpriseSG) is the government agency championing enterprise development. They work with committed companies to build capabilities, innovate and internationalise.

They also support the growth of Singapore as a hub for global trading and startups and build trust in Singapore’s products and services through quality and standards.

Visit www.enterprisesg.gov.sg for more information.
